definition: lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

sentences.english: In this mode, the position of the vessel is controlled by a PME.
sentences.chinese: 這種模式有時叫見風使舵，船舶位置由PME控制。

sentences.english: She would balance and temporize endlessly before reaching a decision.
sentences.chinese: 她在做出決定前會不斷地猶豫觀望和見風使舵。

sentences.english: You are fit for a captain, having it both ways .
sentences.chinese: 你適合當船長，擅長見風使舵。
